description: T522 - Malus sp. (Apple sp.):LPD - Lift low canopy, pedestrian clearance - to 2.5 m over footpath.T524 - Cedrus libani 'Glauca' (Blue Cedar of Lebanon):EW00 - End weight reduction - reducing three extraneous branches (see photos) overhanging car parking by 1.5 m to reduce loading andprevent failure onto parked cars. Final cuts to be no greater than 30 mm diameter, leaving furnishing growth to minimise visual impact.T525 - Fagus sylvatica f. purpurea (Purple Beech):LPD - Lift low canopy, pedestrian clearance - to 3 m over footpath.T528 - Acer platanoides (Norway Maple):RVB - Remove suspended/broken limb(s) - hanger at 5 m over fenceline to North (2 cm dia.) and minor deadwood at 3.5 m in same locationto prevent failure onto footpath.T529 - Cerasus avium (Wild Cherry):PRS - Prune from adjacent structure - to clear lamp column by 1 m and lift low canopy to 2.5 m over footpath.T531 - Cedrus deodara (Deodar):RBW - Reduce heavy branch weight - reducing branches overhanging driveway and along drive edge attached to the subordinate stem to thenorthwest (see photo) by 1.5 m to reduce loading and prevent failure onto drive and parked cars. Final cuts to be no greater than 30 mmdiameter, leaving furnishing growth to minimise visual impact.T532 & T534 - Fagus sylvatica f. purpurea (Purple Beech):LPD - Lift low canopy, pedestrian clearance - to 3 m over footpath.T648 - Corylus avellana (Common Hazel):LPD - Lift low canopy, pedestrian clearance - to 2.5 m over footpath.T652 - Corylus maxima 'Purpurea' (Purple Filbert):RVS - Remove faulted stem(s) - 3 dead stems leaving all live coppice regeneration to prevent failure onto footpath and allow for improvedaesthetic in keeping with the surrounding garden.T656 - Celtis sp. (Nettle Tree):FLG - Fell ground level - due to major decline resulting from significant bark wounding to prevent dead stems failing onto driveway, and tofacilitate replanting.SPG - Stump, grind/remove - to facilita
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
